reviewText: it took me awhile to accept his transformation to Yusuf Islam but once i did, i was rewarded.  the talent & voice of Cat Stevens is intact.  this show was beautifully set & recorded.  i like it even better than Majikat and as much as his old KCET concert.his updates of his classics still retain their original spirit & the new songs stand well next to the classics, not like other classic rockers' new songs which audiences politely bear through in order to hear the hits.i hope he performs more & i'm glad he has given life back to his music.  like it saids in the bible, he has a special light too precious to keep locked away.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I must now admit I was at first unsure about ordering this. Wow, am I glad I did. The first hour contains a full "concert" of many thoughtful songs, in a peaceful setting with an audience. Then a wonderful kind of documentary on his life & career. Followed by a quiet, casual,  and thoughtful finale. We are left understanding him a great deal more. And I really now understand Peace Train, and the importance of Father and Son, as music and in his own life. He is a peaceful man we can learn from, and I thank him. Above all listen to his lyrics. There are teachers among us in life.
summary: Excellent music, documentary, and a look into his soul.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Cat Stevens by any other name still makes great music. His voice and music has always soothed me since the first time I heard him and that has not changed.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's a great DVD.... the performance is pretty good... the music is fantastic... The DVD extras are nice....Great to See Yusuf/Cat back... his performance is great. His voice is just as great as it was during his prime... Alun Davis plays a pretty good guitar with Yusuf just like the good ol days...Choice of songs for the set are pretty good... though I wished he had included 'Longer Boats', 'Moonshadow' , 'But I might Die Tonight'
summary: They Don't Make Em Like  They Used To

reviewerName: PMFPS "Music is the key to All That Is."
reviewText: To some, he may still be Cat Stevens ... to others, Yusuf.Either way you look at it though, the man's still GOT IT and can deliver it like it's nobody's business.Simply beautiful ... and highly recommended!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is just about perfect....a wonderful concert filmed with taste and style..performed by the great Cat Stevens (Yusuf Islam) with panache and exquisite musicianship...just lovely. Their is also a BONUS 1hr BBC documentary on this amazing singer/songwriter.AND..if that isn't enough for your $15...another section of the DVD has a 15 minute making of for his latest album and its really terrific. It also has a couple of beautifully filmed videos for his new songs and Cat/Yusuf sits on a couch with a nylon string guitar and plays solo versions of Peace Train and Midday....and Where do the Children Play?...wow what an embarrasment of riches..allmost 3 hours of glorious music!!! This is a perfect companion to the existing film from 1976 Majikat...just 30 years later!!! I can't stress enough the quality of the production...its just filmed stunningly beautifully...first class in every way and on top of it...Cat/Yusuf emerges as one of the kindest souls to walk the planet and most talented as well...
Title: N/A
